name: Hampton Inn Chicago/Elgin

reviews.text: This property is showing signs of age. Staff is very friendly and attrntive. Bit has a bit of a old musty feel. Holiday inn right next store had better rates and is new. This is not my usual expire I have grown to know from the Hampton brand.
reviews.title: Outdated. Not what I have come to expect from ham proms previous properties.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hampton is adequate. The lobby has been renovated; but the AC unit in our guest room needed to be replaced or at the least, repaired. The fan only worked on automatic, it did not work on low or high, resulting in the fan cycling on and off all night which awakened us all night.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: It's one of the best Hampton Inns we have ever stayed at...great service, comfortable beds and right off the highway. The hot tub could use a little maintenance, but the other amenities were EXCELLENT!
reviews.title: One of the best...
overall Great hotel
reviews.text: Very nice property, staff were very accommodating. I felt almost as if we were at home at the hotel. I would be happy to work with such a nice group of employees in such a well kept property. Thank You

We are traveling across the country. This was hotel number 5 and by far, not the best. The positives were: the woman at the front desk was very nice! The pool area was clean with plenty of towels. There was coffee and yummy freshly made cookies available all day. There was also the standard free breakfast. All of these things were very much appreciated.
reviews.title: OK...
Hampton Inn, Elgin - excellent value and service
reviews.text: We would highly recommend this Hampton Inn location. The staff were friendly and efficient and very helpful in assisting us with directions in and around the Chicago area. The breakfast was hot with a good variety of fresh items, and the location was easy to find which can be difficult around the Illinois tollway.

My family (5 rooms) stayed at this Hampton facility last weekend. We found the inn to be very clean and the staff very friendly. Breakfast was decent. We did not use the pool or workout area, so I cannot comment on those amenities. My husband and I had some trouble with our key card and had to have it recoded 3x, but the desk staff was very apologetic and even offered us a 'goodie bag', including an Amazon gift card, to make up for our inconvenience. I would definitely recommend this Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Convenient

reviews.text: Rooms need redoing in furniture and carpet. Breakfast area also needs rearranging badly. Needs new air conditioning system. Rooms were too noisy. The breakfast offered is just ok, need to have fresh eggs and well cooked sausage and bacon. Need to post a sign in eating area to please not come down to eat in your pajamas.
reviews.title: Needs Revamping

reviews.text: My room smelled like someone had been smoking in it. The receptionist upon arrival wasn't very pleasant and I almost felt as though I was troubling her with questions. The employee who ran the breakfast was exceptional though!
reviews.title: Smelly Room

reviews.text: When traveling for business, I am not all that interested in alot of "site seeing." I like a place that is clean, convenient, and has the necessary ammenties to fulfill my requirements. Hampton Inns fit my needs for business travel.
reviews.title: Hampton consistancy is good

reviews.text: We stayed here in July for a trip to Santa's Village with kids. We had two rooms booked with passes to Santa's Village for 4 included. Excellent price. Great Deal. We had 4 adults and 3 toddlers.
reviews.title: Great Deal Great Location

reviews.text: Rooms were renovated, clean and spacious. No complaints. Bed was comfy. Linens were all clean. Very nice room.
reviews.title: Recommendation for Business Travel

reviews.text: The pool was great, clean and big enough for the kids to play in. Hot tub was hot and in working order.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Visit August 2013

reviews.text: Reception staff was excellent, quick check in and check out no issues at all.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay!

reviews.text: It was an easy hotel to get to, and very well worth what we paid to stay. Will book this hotel next year for our trip to Santa's Village.
reviews.title: Very family friendly

reviews.text: This hotel was a great place to stat that was until we got a call from the "front desk" stating others were complaining about hearing a dog bark. Huh? Did you see us come in with a dog? Do YOU hear dog? Really? In any case, the beds are super soft. No sofa beds for lounging though. Gives you a good "at home" feeling with fresh fruit and big family style kitchen table in the lobby. Oh and the hot chocolate was awesome especially coming out of the pool. which they need to increase in size. The staff was friendly and catering. Always a plus
reviews.title: Dog gone good
OK
reviews.text: This hotel was fine for the short time we stayed. The king sized bed was very lumpy and had standard size pillows. The walls are thin, all I can say is if you are in love take it some place with better insulation between the rooms. Our neighbors were busy all night long. Breakfast was nice. Staff was very nice.

The hotel was a 30 minute drive form where I was doing business but as the hockey playoffs were in town I wound up here be default. Sometimes good things happen when you least expect them. Very clean facility, I had to stay an additional week and the staff kept me in the same room. I was working very late hours and always had secure access. I had to use the laundry service (first time ever in a hotel) and they made my jeans look brand new! Not many places to eat in the area around the hotel but the trade off of easy highway access and secure surroundings are worth it. Now if somebody could address the tolls ....
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: This totally "average" Hampton Inn presents itself as a very good value and a decent place for the traveler looking to stay in the western suburbs of Chicago. All aspects were fine for this business traveler. My only wish is for a comfy reading chair in the room.
reviews.title: A basic Hampton Inn equates to decent hotel with great value

reviews.text: From arrival to departure overall a very good experience, could use a better soap size and a stronger coffee. A better and bigger lounge would be helpful, unfortunately, the hotel does not have enough room to accommodate this request! helpful staff and quite courteous.
reviews.title: Stay Expeience

description: Million Dollar Extreme Makeover Completed May 2005 One of Elgin’s best hotels, the Hampton Inn Chicago/Elgin hotel Chicago, Illinois provides lodging in Chicago/Elgin near Grand Victoria Casino Riverboat and O’Hare Airport. We feature a wonderful Complimentary On the House Breakfast Buffet with Hot Items every morning from 6 a.m. to 10 a.m. which offers over 40 delicious items. Additionally, we also offer complimentary cookies Monday through Thursday nights, Indoor Pool, Whirlpool, Fitness Center, and Free Wireless High Speed Internet available in all Guest Rooms,Lobby, and Business Center.
